title: 111_hr1834
content: The Native American Business Development Enhancement Act of 2009 establishes the Office of Native American Affairs and Tribal Business Information Centers Program under the Small Business Act. The Act amends the Small Business Act to include an Associate Administrator for Native American Affairs. The Native American Business Development Enhancement Act of 2009 establishes the Office of Native American Affairs and Tribal Business Information Centers Program under the Small Business Act, including an Associate Administrator for Native American Affairs. The Office of Native American Affairs, established under the Native American Business Development Enhancement Act of 2009, is responsible for increasing Native American entrepreneurship, expanding access to business training and financing, and reaching out to Native American communities for entrepreneurial development. The Office of Native American Affairs, established under the Native American Business Development Enhancement Act of 2009, focuses on increasing Native American entrepreneurship and providing business training and financing to Native American communities. The office also oversees the implementation of Administration initiatives related to Native American entrepreneurial development and is authorized to receive $2,000,000 for fiscal years 2010 and 2011. Additionally, the Administrator can operate a Tribal Business Information Centers program in collaboration with other federal departments and agencies. The Tribal Business Information Centers program, established under the Native American Business Development Enhancement Act of 2009, provides Native American populations with business training, counseling, and entrepreneurial development assistance. The Administrator can designate entities as centers and make grants of up to $300,000 for workshops, counseling, and training. The Administrator can designate centers for Native American business development training and access to resources. Regulations will be established for grants, and appropriations are authorized for fiscal years 2010 and 2011. The term 'Native American' is defined in this subsection. The term 'Native American' is defined as an Indian tribe member, Alaska Native, or Native Hawaiian in this subsection for fiscal year 2011. Small Business Development Center assistance is provided to Indian tribe members, Alaska Natives, and Native Hawaiians. The Small Business Act is amended to provide an additional grant for Small Business Development Centers in eligible states to assist Indian tribe members, Alaska Natives, and Native Hawaiians with business startups and expansions on Indian lands. The Small Business Act is amended to provide a grant for Small Business Development Centers in eligible states with a population of at least 1% Indian tribe members, Alaska Natives, and Native Hawaiians. Grant applicants must submit an application outlining their goals and capabilities to provide training and services to these communities. The Small Business Act is amended to provide a grant for Small Business Development Centers in eligible states with a population of at least 1% Indian tribe members, Alaska Natives, and Native Hawaiians. Grant applicants must comply with all requirements, except for matching funds, and provide details on the location, funding needed, and consultation with tribal councils. The Small Business Act is amended to provide grants for Small Business Development Centers in eligible states with a population of at least 1% Indian tribe members, Alaska Natives, and Native Hawaiians. The maximum grant amount is $300,000 per fiscal year, and final regulations will be issued to establish standards for educational, technical, and support services provided by the Centers. Small Business Development Centers receiving grants must adhere to standards for work plans and seek advice from tribal organizations on assisting Indian tribe members, Alaska Natives, and Native Hawaiians. Definitions for terms used in the paragraph are also provided. The term 'Indian lands' is defined as Indian country, Indian reservation, or reservation as per specific laws. 'Indian tribe' refers to any group of Indians in the contiguous United States. The Metlakatla Indian Community, eligible for services provided to Indians by the Secretary of the Interior, is recognized as Indians. The term 'Indian tribe member' refers to a member of an Indian tribe, excluding Alaska Natives. 'Alaska Native' is defined as per the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act. 'Native Hawaiian' includes individuals meeting specific criteria. The term 'Native Hawaiian' refers to a U.S. citizen who is a descendant of the aboriginal people of Hawaii before 1778. Authorization of appropriations is provided for carrying out this definition. Funding of $7,000,000 for fiscal years 2010 and 2011 is authorized for this paragraph. Funding limitations include additional funds beyond program limitations and the requirement of specific appropriations for implementation. The House of Representatives passed the bill on November 19, 2009.
